## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)
library(shiny)
tuit <- read_excel("C:/Users/bbarry17/Downloads/InState_Tuition_Public_4yr.xlsx")

set.seed(111)
smpl<-100
rn<-1000
bin.widt=300
df<-data.frame()

 for(x in 1:rn){
   mu<-data.frame(mean(sample(tuit$tuition2,smpl,replace = FALSE)),x)
   names(mu)<- c('mu','i')
   df<-rbind(df,mu)


 }

 pop<-ggplot(tuit,aes(x=tuition2)) +
   geom_histogram(aes(y=..density..), fill='red', col='black',inherit.aes = TRUE)+
   geom_density(aes(y = ..density..))

 sim<-ggplot(df,aes(x=mu)) +
   geom_histogram(aes(y=..density..), fill='lightgray', col='black',inherit.aes = TRUE)+
   geom_density(aes(y=..density..))
   stat_function(fun = dnorm, args = list(mean=mean(df$mu), sd=sd(df$mu)))
 pop
sim
```
